archetype_name: Family Turkish & North African Suppers (Medium, 30–60, Intermediate)
name: Harissa Chicken Thigh Kebabs with Saffron Basmati and Sumac Cucumber-Tomato Salad
description: Skewered harissa-yoghurt chicken roasted until charred, served with saffron basmati rice and a bright sumac cucumber-tomato salad. Medium warmth with balanced, family-friendly sides.
prep_steps: Preheat oven grill/broiler to high (or 220°C). Line a baking tray and set a rack on top; lightly oil the rack.
Rinse basmati rice under cold water until it runs clear; drain well.
Bloom saffron in 2 tablespoons warm water; set aside.
Cut chicken thighs into 3 cm chunks. Mince garlic. Zest 1 lemon and juice both lemons; keep juice divided for marinade, salad, and yoghurt.

In a bowl, mix harissa paste, half the yoghurt, half the minced garlic, lemon zest, 1 tablespoon lemon juice, 1 tablespoon olive oil, 1/2 teaspoon salt, black pepper, cumin, and paprika. Toss in chicken and marinate 15 minutes.
Dice cucumber, halve cherry tomatoes, thinly slice red onion, and chop parsley and mint.
In a small bowl, combine remaining yoghurt with remaining minced garlic, 1 tablespoon lemon juice, a pinch of salt, and chopped mint; set aside.
Thread marinated chicken onto meat skewers, packing pieces snugly.
cook_steps: Make the rice: Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a pot over medium. Add drained basmati rice; stir 1 minute. Add 3 cups water, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and the saffron with its liquid. Bring to a boil, cover, reduce to low, and cook 12 minutes. Turn off heat and rest 10 minutes covered.
Roast the kebabs: Place skewers on the prepared rack. Grill/broil 10–12 minutes, turning once, until browned and cooked through.
Toss the salad: In a bowl, combine cucumber, cherry tomatoes, red onion, and half the parsley. Add 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1 tablespoon lemon juice, sumac, a pinch of salt, and black pepper; toss.
Finish the rice: Fluff with a fork and fold in remaining parsley.
Serve: Plate saffron rice, top with chicken kebabs, add salad on the side, and spoon the mint-garlic yoghurt over or alongside.
